I personally prefer Cancun, but if I don't have wheels at the moment and am feeling like a burrito, I'll go here if this is the closest place (there's this one on Church near Market and another one right by the Civic center).

I don't enjoy their grilled steak as much as I do enjoy Cancun's, but beside that I'd say this place is definitely up there.  I also like the idea of the self-serve salsa and how they have some options.

The service is also always pretty friendly and laid back.  Not much else to say...
author: Anx R.

description: My sister, who has lived out here far longer than I, has always raved about this place.  "They have the best carnitas super burrito!" was the standard claim every time we drove by.  OK sis...time to put a burrito where my mouth is, let's go.  The carnitas was crispy out and tender in, they had a choice of 3 different beans (black, pinto, refried), they pre-grilled the tortilla to melt the cheese.  They had a choice of guac or avocado.  It was a MEAN burrito to be sure!!  The place is par for the course as far as price and decor, but the burrito kicks ass, equal to or slightly greater than El Farolito.
author: Garrett C.

description: Seriously good mexican food.  And prices you just can't beat.  It may look a little run down, but not to worry about that- as soon as you take your first bite, you won't be paying attention to your location anymore. So yummy.
author: Darian H.

description:
love love love the Quesadilla El Castillito... 

basically just a really juicy grilled burrito (gotta do it with the carne asada) rather than your more traditional quesadilla.

only tragedy is that they aren't open as late as most of their mission counterparts... que lastima :(
author: marcus f.

description: Best burrito in the city.  The chicken has been marinated in some yummyness.  Also a big fan of the tomato, spinach, wheat, or flour options for the tortillas.
author: Brian H.

description:
About the only the thing this place had going for it was its cheap prices. A friend told me he just paid $8 for a burrito that was $6 a couple of months ago.

That's right an instant 25% increase...for this tripe!

No wonder I never see lines anymore when I walk past.
author: Church Street J.

description: Solid burrito shop.  Good prices.  Tasty burritos.  Really awesome friendly staff.
author: Trey d.

description:
el castillito is definately one of my favourite taquerias. great super burritos and good meats, i especially like the al pastor. adequate salsa bar. 

if you're in the hood and need a taco/burrito fix then this spot will hit that spot.

(that ed dude needs to chill out on his comments, too many fits, even at restaurants, are a sign of mental illness)
author: xxalex k.

description: Spend less than 5 bucks on a burrito and you'll get a huge silver torpedo  filled with so much amazing mexican goodness.
author: Trevor J.

description: DELICIOUS.  I feel like the luckiest person on earth having moved from Boston where Mexican food is basically non-existent to find myself within walking distance of this little gem.  Their burritos are so tasty and the green salsa at the salsa bar wins the prize for my favorite condiment on earth.  It's also super cheap.
author: Erin L.

description:
Great place. 
Fast service. 
Awesome flavor. 

Had the super grilled chicken burrito with black beans and an Orchata. Orchata was great, lots of cinnamon. 
HUGE burrito and I almost ate all of it! 

Great price. 

Will  be sure to bring friends back.
author: David L.

description:
5 stars for the food, especially the Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor 
2 stars for service
0 stars for atmosphere

Got it, go here for the food. It's enough of a reason.

The al pastor is the best I've ever had. In fact after having it here, I started trying it at other taquerias, to great disappointment.  It's a bit greasy, so I don't go here unless I'm not in the mood to care about eating healthy.

Don't confuse this with the 18th or Mission street locations. 18th St. was just your average taqueria. I haven't tried the Mission location.

Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor Casadilla El Catillito with al pastor
author: V M.

description: Absolutely nothing I've ever had can touch the tacos al pastor at El Castillito.  Perfection!
author: J B.

description: I think these guys make a better super veggie burrito and have better chips that Taqueria Cancun.
author: Erin S.

description: This place rocks.  It where we go for burritos in San Francisco, period.  When we live on Haight street we were close to El Balazo but it doesn't compare to El Castillito.  The super burrito is $7 and will put you on your ass.  It's huge.  But their secret weapon is the salsa verde.  It's worth the trip by itself.
author: Vic A.

description:
Simply AWESOME!  The vegetarian burrito on a Spinach Tortilla with the green sauce is my absolute favorite thing in the world!

And it's cheap to boot!  A burrito and a beer for under 7 bucks?  BEAT THAT! :)
author: Catherine R.

description: my usual thing at taqueria joints is the super chicken burrito. kinda like how some folks get pad thai every time to gauge thai restaurants.. but i digress. anyways, el castillito did not disappoint. we came here after a long tiring, (but relaxing) day at the beach, empty stomachs and all. the burrito was huuuuge... i mean, i was hungry coming in and still could not finish the damn thing, and trust me i usually do. flavorful chicken, good salsa bar, ok chips. jen is happy.
author: Jennie L.

description:
as far as food goes, castillito is *fine* 

the [male] staff, however, leave a lot to be desired.  incident #1:  as i'm paying for my veggie burrito, i notice someone had drawn a rose, a smiley face and a heart on the foil with a sharpie.  the cashier points it out and smilingly comments, "you'd better not show your boyfriend that, otherwise you will receive a beating. have a nice night!"  wow.  he could have been talking about his grandmother.  or a sunny day--the tone of voice he was using was friendly and warm.  but he was talking about violence.  in a glib and inane way that made me think he considers domestic violence totally normal.  incident #2:  i'm standing in line to order and i notice the dude making the food is angry. he's throwing food around and barking terse words at the patron before me.  i begin ordering a fish taco when said dude roars, "chinga tu madre," at another co-worker.  this means, "fuck your mother."  it was so shocking and off-putting that i canceled my order and left.  i will not be returning to el castillito.  [duh]
author: Sandra T.

description: At first look this place is small, scuzzy hole in the wall. An it is ! Beyond the peeling paint there  is great mexican food to be had. For around 4$ You can get a hearty vegetarian burrito in an assortment of different wraps and stuffings. The cooks are sweet guys who are quick and who help you out when you need the tapatio!. I love this place .
author: Tamrin H.

description: Great little hole in the wall place! the best mexican food in the area
author: R J.

description: This place is bomb!! Close to my house too. Mmmmmmm! Love the green salsa.
author: Lucy G.

description: burritos not good due to mushy rice    all-meat tacos still the BEST!  and those grilled in oil whole jalepenos are out of sight!
author: suzanne e.

description: I used to go to this spot cause it was the only kinda real Mexican food round my hood. Too many times I've paid for a super bar and got a reg..... You gotta watch them to get what you want,,,,tooo much work and it's greeeeeeeeeesyyyyy As h3ll.
author: MrHowWhat Y.

description: my heart sank when i saw them putting sliced cheese on my burrito.  simply lackluster in every way.
author: beltrand a.

description: Serving size is a little smaller than the average, but very flavorful. Price is somewhat higher, but worth it for the taste. Always fresh.
author: John B.

description: For a delicious, filling and inexpensive meal I go to El Castilito for the veggie tacos. I really like their selection of salsas too.
author: anne P.

description: dude, i was seriously addicted to this place for so long. i haven't been there in like a month, but me and my co-workers used to make the trek from west portal just to come here after work (sometimes 2-3x a week!) but yeah, love their half chicken half pastor burrito with some spicy salsa in a spinach tortilla... THAT SHIT IS SO BOMB!!!
author: Nitai V.

description: seriously dangerous burritos. they're huge. they could even be two meals if you're not ravenous.  really good carnitas and everything is totally fresh. bottom line: everything is big, fresh and cheap!
author: lisa w.

description: this place has saved my life time and time again when I didn't feel like dropping mad cash for a a falafel sandwich.  Now I'm not so sure seeing as how my last experience there was in '02.  But I have very fond memories of choosing between eating out or buying groceries from the Safeway across the street.  Castillito's awesome prices could be said to have tipped the scales in its favor in those moments of uncertainty.  Well, that and my stomach growling at my standing at the J stop.  Be forewarned: I recall their veggie burritos being on the massive side.
author: Quilty K.

description: I went in there because i saw an ad in SF weekly for el castillito that said buy 1 burritto and get one free ....i was walking buy and remember the ad  that was in this weeks sf weekly but i did not bring the coupon and the woman who was working at the time asked me for the ad and i said it did not say to bring it in and she still did not honor the ad. i had never been there before and probably wont go back not just because she didnt honor the ad but because she was rude and i had already placed my order for two burritos being that i was with a friend then she said cancel the other order.....all she was going to do was throw it away anyways ....... what a waste of food and they lost a customer .
author: Perri V.

description: By far one of my favorite mexican places in the city.  Worth the driving around and looking for parking.  Quesadilla Suiza!
author: Mike L.

description: im here like 3/4 times a week.  but i'm definitely not the only castillito fan.  i swear this one guy must stalk me, because he's there everytime i'm there (and i go at the most random times), unless he's just always there.  cheap but surprisingly delicious food.  also great late night.
author: Julia B.

description: my favorite place for burritos. sometimes i'll sneak over there and get one to take home (to the richmond) just in case i need a snack. they're big, juicy and well seasoned. my girlfriend isn't fond of their seasonings (she thinks they're too sweet), so minus one star.
author: Greg A.

description: maybe i'm just not a good taqueria goer.  too many ingredient related questions or something?  or too little.  they put something really spicy in my burrito when nothing spicy/salsa-y was specified please.  it hurt me.  maybe it's because i don't speak spanish.  i feel hated when i come here.
author: Monk R.

description: Best burrito I've had so far. their prices are higher than i'd like,but that's my ONLY gripe.
author: Tom H.

description: Great burritos - makes the best chorizo & egg breakfast burrito in SF!  Grills the meat while you watch so you know what goes in your burrito and can ask for extra ingredients per your taste.  Self-service salsa bar and the chips are best with extra salt.
author: kristy l.

description: There is no better better burrito in the city than El Castillito's Pastor Super Burrito. I grew up in San Diego where the carne asada reigns king, here in San Francsico I have yet to find anything even remotely close... I'm sorry, but a burrito should not have beans, rice, lettuce, tomato, five girls dancing to the sound of la cucaracha, and a bucket of sour creme inside.  A burrito should be meat.  And well marinated delicious meat at that... but this is San Francisco and I realize that things are done a bit differently here... At least the Super Al Pastor allows me to forget for a while what it is that I am missing.  The guys who make the burritos are hillarious and always down for a little banter back and forth.  The tortas are good, as are the tacos and quesadillas but go for the super al pastor and get the fresh avacado instead of the guacamole.  Oh, and ask for extra mota (cillantro, hillarious)....
author: Darren R.

description: i got the breakfast burrito yesterday and it was sooo good! lots of chorizo and 3 eggs cooked to perfection! the only thing i'd do differently is ask for cheese on it - as i thought they'd automatically put cheese on it but they didn't. this is not something you'll want to order regularly as like i said they put a ton of chorizo on it and i'm sure this can't be totally healthy for your cholesteral levels.
author: James J.

description: i don't know what the hype is about this place..i have definitely had better burritos else where..i ordered the carne asada super burrito spicy and it was salty and dripping with oil at the bottom...i dont know if it was an off day but i can't see myself going back there anytime soon..i guess i won't be riding this 4-5 star yelp train...
author: Jenny G.

description: I was really looking forward to a good wet burrito, but I was a bit disappointed by this place. The people at the counter weren't very nice, the ambiance wasn't very welcoming or pleasant, and the wet burrito (with Chicken and green sauce) was nothing special, thought it was big and pretty cheap. I'm not planning to come back here anytime soon.
author: Gregory G.

description: You can't beat there Pasor Burritos!! The Meat is oh soo goood....! And its soooo big you get two Meals!!
author: Larry L.

description: the burritos are huge, cheap, great, and grilled, which is obviously the bomb.  well i guess it's all been said already, basically it's the only taqueria worth visiting in the castro.
author: Wayne B.

description: There's a reason there is always a line at this yummy place... not only is it cheap, but the food is divine... try the "quesadilla suiza" which is more of a grilled burrito than a traditional quesadilla... add onion and blackbeans and YUMMMM! Choose beef over chicken...
author: Michael H.

description: On a rainy Sunday (which could basically be any Sunday in '08) a friend and I were craving a mean burrito. This city has a plethora of culinary options but being from SoCal if there is one thing I miss it is easily accessible quality Mexican food. Sure, I have followed the tractor beam to the mission and plowed through La Taqueria and El Farolito but I prefer my burrito runs sans stabbings. Sorry, maybe that was a punch after the bell towards the Mish, I do have love for the Mish but getting there to eat is always a struggle. Unfortunately the Mexican joints close to where I live and work think authentic means turning up Richie Valens greatest hits on the jukebox. After searching through the yelp annals I came upon El Castillo. Still infant enough in it's reviews that I didn't feel like I was reading War in Peace and everyone across the board seemed to enjoy their burritos . . .perfect. Someone described the neighborhood as the loin but I would say more Castro. With Safeway parking across the street and street parking I was already in a good mood. The moment I glanced at the menu I knew the Supper Burrito was where it was at. If there is a better designed entre than the burrito please let me know because this foil wrapped flavor bomb gets incrementally better with each bite. With gravity on its side all the flavor has a mosh pit at the bottom of your burrito, nothing but taste overload can result from this.
author: Chad B.

description: Reading below, I have to say the negative reviews are just plain weird.  As for me, I live in the Haight and have at least 4 burrito places between me and El Castillito.  I will go out of my way for the chicken burritos here.  So much flavor!
author: Jeremy R.

description: the best of the el castillito (i have been to all of them) unless im in the mood to hang out at the mission street location to change it up a bit
author: Heather S.

description: "MMM, mmm, good."  Is really all I can say about this worthy of the mission mexican joint.  They serve their stuff up kind of subway style -"cilantro, onion, sour cream, avocado, hot salsa?" so you can pick and choose your ingredients.  They have spinach and whole wheat tortillas (+ regular kind).  I have only tried the burritos because they make me so happy but I would bet the rest of the menu is delicious.  Furthermore - there is one chef that illustrates the contents of your burrito on the tin foil wrapping (I got a little chicken) - nice touch!
author: Lauren S.

description: This is the place to go for burritos when you're standing on market and church. I'm sure there are at least 5 mexican places within a one block radius. It might be a little bit farther to walk, but those extra 20 steps will make a difference to your tummy. I've only had the burritos here but they are good and cooked to order. There's a reason why it's always busy.
author: Luke F.

description: I have a love-relationship with most San Francisco taquerias, and living on the Castro/Mission border doesn't make things much easier. El Castillito is a nice alternative to the similarly suited Casa Mexicana and Azteca Taqueria on Church Street. Large, cheap-ish burritos hit the spot. The only reason I stray closer to Market for a burrito is if I have no cash in my pocket.
author: Derek B.

description: I love super burritos. I've been all over this town in search of the best burrito, and so far this is it for me. Pancho Villa - the hype left me expecting more, Cancun - good but overrated, Farolito - everything they led me to believe, BUT it's still no Castillito. They grill the tortilla with the cheese on it, they pile on all the ingredients, it comes out super hot, their horchata is really good, the super nachos are pretty amazing. Even on an off day at Castillito, I still leave feeling pretty satisfied.
author: Prairie D.

description: Cheap and fast. Perfect when you just need something good and fresh. Regular shrimp burritos are big like a 'super' at some other places. Really good, still S.F. priced but worth it.
author: K T.

description: I just went here for the first time based on Yelp.  The tacos do indeed live up to the hype (at least the Al Pastor).  The salsas were good, but not as amazing as El Tonayense.
author: Simon G.

description: Oh my God, their Super Burritos are insane! Seriously, the beef burrito is perfectly spicy, and you can watch them fix your ginormous (two mealer) burrito right there. The cook and cashier are always nice, and the place is pretty clean too...sorry, that's important to me. They sell fresh squeezed juices too, which intrigues me, but I confess, I've never tried them.
author: Sarah Y.

description: Great burritos- they grill the tortillas, which makes all the difference.  Come here if you are really hungry because the burritos are the size of a small child.  Mine was so good that I ate it all, and I really regretted it later.  But at the time of consumption, I could not have been happier.
author: Molly C.

description: Some of the best tacos al pastor in town.  And it sounds odd, but their diced onion tastes better than other onion. The salsa verde is fantastic.  The basic veggie burrito is solid because they grill the tortilla, give plenty of avocado, and will put a gallon of salsa verde in it if you ask nicely.  I can't speak to the rest of the menu because the tacos al pastor have my heart.  They also serve breakfast.
author: C G.

description: This place has the best Mexican food in the Castro/Church area.  Great burritos and of course the pollo asada plate which is grilled chicken, beans, rice, salsa, sour cream, guacamole, lettuce and tomato with as many corn tortillas as you want for less than 7 bucks... the only reason it is getting 4 instead of five is the crappy chips.
author: Daniel S.

description: I have been milling around the neighborhood for 8 years and had never walked in - what a shame.  As we were walking by, my friends pushed me in.  I wasn't going to order cuz I'm usually disappointed with many taquerias.  When I saw the cook trimming steak and the meat was pinkish/red and looked SO fresh I decided to give it a try.  Freakin best carne asada quesadilla I've had anywhere.  Super fresh, tasty, and HUGE.  Now I'm a big guy and I couldn't finish it - was wishing I could tho it was so good.  I've been going back since.  I used to head to that neck of the woods to stop by Burgermeister and although I love Burgermeister for half the price I get a killer burrito or quesadilla at El Castillito.  Gotta try it.
author: Adrian M.

description: pastor quesadilla is one of the best things in the whole universe. greasy and heavy and perfect. it's enough food for two meals but you know you're going to eat it all in one sitting. with two pacificos. heaven.
author: Brian K.

description: i love this place. it is definitely my go-to place in the castro. hell, i'll even go to the castro to have a burrito here! the staff is really friendly and it's got a good vibe with a decent jukebox
author: joseph j.

description: 5 stars for the al pastor, no questions asked. delicious, juicy, tasty, overflowing burritto with good ingredients at a good price. i don't live in the neighborhood but i go out of my way to get this burrito because it's simply delicious. you won't be disappointed!
author: Raphael M.
